title: Ticket #1962: win7 net stop condor == hard kill
description:
In testing we found that net stop condor under windows 7 which used to perform a softkill, hardkills the processes, which can leave errant forked processes on the system.

repro: run some jobs tail -f MasterLog in one terminal net stop condor in the other. There are no logs.. Master-Tree goes poof
remarks:
2011-Mar-22 15:42:58 by johnkn:
What's actually happening is that net stop condor is crashing inside the service callback for Stop Service. A simple de-ref of a pointer that may be null is the problem. this is an easy fix.

However, when you stop the master using net stop condor OR condor_off -master DaemonCore::Send_Signal is recursing in a way that does not appear to be intentional. the recursion does stop after going about 7 levels but it is likely that there is still a bug in the way shutdown is handled.

2011-Mar-23 09:19:23 by tstclair:
verified fix on 3/23/2011
check_ins: 2011-Mar-22 15:48   Check-in [21116]: fix for #1962, net stop condor command is crashing inside the handler for Service Stop. pidinfo is allowed to be NULL in DaemonCore::Send_Signal, but the test for child_session_id did not test pidinfo before using it. (By John (TJ) Knoeller )
